senses.sense_definition: Relating to or characteristic of a system of government in which priests rule in the name of God or a god.

examples.text: The ancient civilization was known for its strict <w>theocratical</w> rule led by high priests.
Critics argued that the proposed laws would push the country toward a <w>theocratical</w> system.

senses.sense_definition: A person who supports or participates in a government ruled by religious authority.

examples.text: As a dedicated <w>theocratical</w>, he believed all state laws should derive from scripture.
The meeting was attended by several <w>theocraticals</w> who wished to merge church and state.
